message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the task of recognizing pain in horses from videos, which involves analyzing the visual dynamics of the animals. Therefore, the most likely category is computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also proposes a deep learning architecture for this task, which involves training a model on a dataset of videos, making it likely to fall under machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the challenges of recognizing pain in non-verbal species, which could be relevant to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) category. Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed model against veterinary expert classification, which involves comparing the model's output to human judgments, making it relevant to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) category.
